newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta call money traded at 7.5/8.0 percent.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta call money traded at 7.5/8.0 percent.

text.p: Jakarta call money was traded at 7.5/8.0 percent on Wednesday on sustained ample liquidity.
Dealers said liquidity remained ample but operators were cautious, trying to keep aside as much liquidity as they could.
"This is a chance for operators to prepare for higher tax payments and to boost rupiah reserves to meet the new reserve requirement rate in April," one state bank dealer said.
"It's no joke. The rise to five percent from three percent is quite significant," the dealer said.
Longer-term rates remained soft on ample condition. One-month was at 10.75 and three at 13.0 percent.
The central bank kept its bilateral rates stable and did not offer overnight SBIs. It offered seven-day SBIs at 6.5 percent, 14-day at 8.5 percent and one-month at 10.75 percent.
The average overnight interbank rate on Tuesday was at 8.28 percent. Bond dealers said prices were edging up slightly on Tuesday afternoon on sustained demand.
They attributed it to new mutual funds looking for attractive fixed returns in the bond market.
The yield of the benchmark PLN V/A bond eased slightly to around 15.0 percent on a price of 107.25 percent.
